name: Acceptance Criteria - All steelwork shall comply with the requirements of NZS 3404.
○ The steel casings / sleeves / liners must have an inside diameter not less than the specified diameter of the pile.
Acceptance Criteria - The concrete mix design must be submitted and approved prior to pouring.
Frequency - Min 10 days prior to works
Acceptance Criteria - All steel shall be in accordance with the appropriate standard as outlined in NZS 3404.
Verifying Document - Delivery Dockets, Mill certs, Galvanising certs
Acceptance Criteria - Piling methodology to be approved by Engineer.
Frequency - Min 10 days prior to works

Acceptance Criteria - All pile locations have been set out as required by the drawings, and agreed upon with the engineer. Piles shall be set out in accordance with the SESOC/NZGS construction specification bored and driven piles 2022. Pile Setout coordinates are attached in 80510096-02B-315-S105
Acceptance Criteria - A Pile Construction Record Card shall be completed for each pile constructed on site, in accordance with AS 2159:2009.
Acceptance Criteria - Each pile foundation shall be excavated to the depth shown on the drawings. The contractor shall arrange for the engineer to inspect each excavated shaft upon completion.
— Position - Tops of piles shall not vary by more than 75mm in horizontal and 25mm in vertical
— Verticality - Max permitted deviation not more than 1:75 (horizontal:vertical)

Acceptance Criteria - Provide a minimum of 24 hours notice of each initial intention to place concrete to the engineer. A Pre-pour Inspection must verify that the pile hole dimensions (600 mm Ø), steel profile (250UC89) and hole cleanliness comply with design requirements. The concrete mix must meet specifications, and safety measures should be in place before proceeding with the pour.
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm correct mix design brought to site
○ concrete placement method that the mix was designed for - Pump Mix
○ type of supplementary cementitious materials (if used);
○ slump (target and actual slump when measured);
○ Associated Products e.g. cement and additives
Specification/Drg Reference - AS/NZS 4671: 2001, 'NZS 3109, 26.1.16 Handling and Placing
Acceptance Criteria - Concreting to be a continous operation between ends of members and/or properly formed construction joints.
○ Concrete should be placed as close to its final position as practical and drop height shall not exceed 2m.
Acceptance Criteria - A set of specimens for compression tests shall consist of 3 specimens from each sample of concrete. 1no. tested at 7 days and 2no. tested at 28 days.
○ Strength of concrete = Dependent on Mix Design.
Acceptance Criteria - Slump tests shall be taken for each truckload of concrete and when compressive testing samples are taken. Slump spread test if slump could exceed 210mm. Slump test tolerances:
Nominated slump (mm) || Tolerance for snatch sample (mm)
Acceptance Criteria - Incorporated in the works within 90minutes of batching.
○ Incorporated in the works within 30minutes of discharge from concrete truck/agitator
Acceptance Criteria - All compaction of concrete shall be carried out in accordance with Clause 7.6 of NZS 3109 as further modified by the following provisions: -

○ All concrete shall be thoroughly compacted during and immediately after depositing, by means of power driven immersion vibrators of a size suitable for the section being poured. At least the top 2m of pile shall be vibrated unless noted otherwise.
○ Position - Tops of piles shall not vary by more than 75mm in horizontal and 25mm in vertical
○ Verticality - Max permitted deviation not more than 1:75 (horizontal:vertical)
○ Pile Head Level - Overcast by min 0.3m and siphoned/pumped off down to finished level. 25mm tolerance
